subject: Philosophy
title: Modus Ponens
description: Learn Modus Ponens in one minute.

hook.text: If it rains, the ground gets wet. It's raining. Therefore the ground is wet. That's modus ponens.

buildup.text: Modus ponens is the most basic rule of deductive logic: if P then Q; P is true; therefore Q.

discovery.text: It's so simple it seems obvious. But it's the foundation for every chain of logical reasoning.

twist.text: Reverse it and you get a fallacy: the ground is wet, therefore it rained. Maybe someone used a hose.

climax.text: Modus ponens is the engine of mathematics, law, and science. Certainty flows from it.

punchline.text: If this, then that. The simplest truth in logic.

quiz.question: What is the structure of modus ponens?
options: If P then Q; P; therefore Q
If P then Q; Q; therefore P
If P then Q; not Q; therefore not P
